clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin D Supplementation in Glomerular Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study: Efficacy and Safety of Vitamin D Supplementation in Glomerular Disease

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Data and Safety Monitoring Plan - Safety Officer

brief_summary.textblock: This multi-site, pilot study will assess vitamin D supplementation in children and young adults with focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS).

detailed_description.textblock: Vitamin D deficiency has been linked to a variety of adverse health outcomes. Nephrotic patients have very low vitamin D levels, and the underlying mechanisms are not known. Furthermore, approaches to safely and effectively supplement vitamin D in these patients have not been established. The purpose of this research study is to learn if vitamin D supplementation is safe and effective in patients with focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS) and to also help establish the treatment guidelines. About 35 patients with FSGS, ages 5-30 years old, will take part in this study. Participants will be asked to take vitamin D supplements each day for 12 weeks and will have 3 study visits.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the efficacy of vitamin D supplementation, by the increase in total and free 25(OH)D levels.
To assess the safety of vitamin D supplementation, by serum Ionized calcium (ICal), Pi, and 25(OH)D, and urinary calcium excretion.

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the innate immune response, measured by changes in the induction of Human cathelicidin antimicrobial protein (hCAP) in human monocytes.
To assess intra-renal inflammation, measured by changes in urinary Macrophage chemo-attractant protein 1 (MCP-1).
To assess arterial stiffness, measured by changes in pulse wave velocity.

arm_group.description: Cholecalciferol, 4000 IUs by mouth daily for 12 weeks

intervention.intervention_name: Cholecalciferol, 4000 IUs by mouth daily for 12 weeks
intervention.description: Supplements will be provided as oral capsules or chewable gummies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males or females, age 5-30 years
- Diagnosis of biopsy-proven FSGS
- Serum 25(OH)D level <20 ng/ml and urine protein:creatinine ratio â‰¥0.5 at Screening Visit
- No new immuno-modulatory agent within prior 3 months of Screening Visit (not including corticosteroid therapy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) <30 ml/min/1.73m2 at Screening Visit
- Serum phosphorus > 5.5 mg/dl or hypercalcemia
- Chronic medical conditions or medications unrelated to the renal disease that may impact vitamin D status
- Known history of kidney stone(s)
